Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk libsmbclient
exit 0

#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi

islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk libsmbclient
exit 0

#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk samba-libs
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: samba bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: Samba is an open-source implementation of the Server Message Block (SMB) protocol and the related Common Internet File System (CIFS) protocol, which allow PC-compatible machines to share files, printers, and other information. The samba packages have been upgraded to upstream version 4.1.12, which provides a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the previous version. (BZ#1110820) This update also fixes the following bugs: The "net ads keytab create" command did not look up Service Principal Names (SPNs) in Active Directory (AD). When the user joined a Linux machine to AD using the "net ads join" command and created a new SPN using the "setspn" utility, only default keytabs were created. Now, all SPNs specified in AD are present. (BZ#955562) Samba was unable to connect to AD when the server operated on both the IPv4 and IPv6 protocols and the client operated only on IPv6. With this update, Samba can join Windows domain networks as intended. (BZ#1024788) The "-S" parameter, accepted by the "net ads leave" command, did not support long NetBIOS names. Trying to leave a domain could fail if the specified name was longer than 15 characters. Now, leaving a domain works as expected, even if the name supplied by "-S" is longer than 15 characters. (BZ#1089940) Previously, the nmb service did not advertise that it can only run when the host supports the IPv4 protocol. Now, when the user runs the "service nmb start" command with IPv4 disabled, the system returns a proper error message informing about the requirement. (BZ#1101210) With the SMB2 and SMB3 protocols, the filename_convert() function was not called on the full path, the last component of the path was not normalized, and listing of large directories did not work correctly. Now, large directories can be listed properly. (BZ#1113064) Samba incorrectly used the O_TRUNC flag when using the open() system call to access the contents of a file that was already opened by a different process, removing the previous contents of the file. The O_TRUNC flag is no longer used in the above scenario, and files are not corrupted. (BZ#1115060) The function used to authenticate the user did not provide all information about the user. When the function was used with another call to authenticate the user over a secure channel, the field for the path to the home directory was empty. Now, the correct function is called, and all required fields are filled out. (BZ#1117770) When a non-root user executed the smbstatus command, the locked files were missing from the command output. Non-root users are now able to display the locked files. (BZ#1171689) Winbind presented unmapped non-POSIX groups when the idmap_ad attribute was configured against the Windows Server 2008 R2 AD. When a user belonged to a group with no POSIX GID attribute assigned, these groups unmapped by AD were displayed after running the "id" and "wbinfo -r" commands on the user. Now, Winbind no longer displays the unmapped groups. (BZ#1127931) This update also adds the following enhancements: This update enables Samba to use the Performance Co-Pilot (PCP). (BZ#717484) Accounts created on the AD side use the Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) keys by default. (BZ#878351) This update adds an alternative implementation of the libwbclient library. To install and choose a libwbclient implementation, use the "alternatives" utility. (BZ#1162526) Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6 contains the pam_smbpass module for authentication. This update adds pam_smbpass to Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7. Note that pam_smbpass is expected to be removed in the future; it is recommended to switch to the pam_winbind module. (BZ#1181319) Users of samba are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements. After installing this update, the smb service will be restarted automatically. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
